name: places/ChIJg8fdcRr2wokR4WVcMs4tfkI
formattedAddress: 37 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 37 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10026, USA

editorialSummary.text: Neighborhood supermarket chain selling dairy, meat, fish & baked goods, plus basic groceries.

originalText.text: Older women Cashier here are just very rude. I honestly left won’t shop here again.

text.text: Older women Cashier here are just very rude. I honestly left won’t shop here again.

originalText.text:
This particular Fine Fare is okay. The prices are reasonable but there are times that they seem lacking in inventory. The produce department is a mish mash of mostly prepackaged items and it would behoove the customer to check the produce, but for the most part is good. My only gripe when it comes to the produce is that I can never get individual jalapeno peppers  and they need a better variety of frozen vegetables which is really lacking.

Their meats are good, but not the best and I'd like it if they offered organic options. Their deli is small and they could use a wider variety of spices.

Other than that, it's close to home and it is a good little neighborhood grocery store. The staff are friendly and helpful. It's a good one quick stop store and one I will continue to go to for my basic needs.

Update: The store has improved and if I could I'd give it 4½ stars. Their selection of frozen foods is better with more healthy alternatives.

Security has improved since my last review and the other thing about the store is that Management is very helpful the cashiers are friendly and courteous.

The only caveat is that they really could benefit from having a seafood department.

They do have discounts and they do rotate their stock regularly so when they have products that are close to their Best Sell By dates they will have great discounts.

All in all they have stepped up their game.

The other cool thing is that they have a few other good stores in that block with a Fish Market, a liquor store, a pharmacy and a fast food restaurant right on the corner plus on the other end is a nice florist.

originalText.text: Harlem Fine Fare is great prices can vary but staff is always there to help and catch you home with items and safety

text.text: Harlem Fine Fare is great prices can vary but staff is always there to help and catch you home with items and safety

originalText.text:
They have their own employees writing positive reviews.

This place is THE SLOWEST supermarket in the city, overpriced too: no such thing as “in and out.” Cashiers are SLOW, self-checkout/express lane is never open. The stock makes NO sense, one example: 11 different kinds of salt and only one kind of pepper big enough for a family of 5. Average time standing in line 10-15 minutes.

They can afford security but not efficient staff.

originalText.text: I've been a customer for several years, since I live so close. My major issue is the manager's won't let paying customers use the bathroom. This is not fair, since i am a frequent customer, whoever the owner is??? Please tell your managers to let Paying customers use the bathroom!
